budgetprincess__: Thinking of ways my abusive partners could die is self care ❤️ or just ignoring them is self- care
mjrawrrrr: Going to a chill bar with live music, trying something new either food or drink, and reading a good book while soaking in the atmosphere is one of my favorite things to do. If going out of the house sounds like too much, then taking a good bubble bath with nice wine and jazz on in the background, followed by a bunch of skincare stuff like masks and stuff is my next favorite. I don't even care how much of the skincare stuff actually does anything, it's just the idea and actions that I'm attempting to take care of myself that is so damn helpful.
lizjdavis: Fav/most regular thing is to make a big batch of something good & nutritious for lunch at work, like I'm giving myself 5 little favors in the future. To help with anxiety I started making note of all the times I did something for myself during the week (worked out, masturbated, read, learned a new thing) and privately thanked myself for being kind to my whole body - so I don't get caught in thinking I need to do and be more for myself or anyone else/ caught in a gross "productivity" loop.
alicewonders: same, healthy practices staying in tune with myself, I ❤️ knowing my body.🤘🏽

theespinningbirdconnita: I express my love to myself by taking a nice bubble bath and drinking some wine after a long day. By doing so I reflect at the things I did good while helping my bodyaches and appreciating my body for what it does for me.
wordsmithtrish: Self love definitely includes orgasms(I'm the best lover I've ever had!) and I used to think that I had to do big things to prove I love myself, such as changing major habits or creating new ones, finishing projects, exercising every damn day. But as I get older i'm finding there is love in little things too. Drinking water, brushing my teeth, taking a moment to take a breath and check in with myself. I ask my friends how they're doing, having the same consideration for myself seems reasonable.
